alert.note: Alert for Hall; Hamilton; Merrick; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 2:09AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western York, Hamilton, southwestern Merrick, southwestern Polk and eastern Hall Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 208 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Phillips, or 11 miles southeast of Grand Island, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Aurora around 220 AM CDT. Hampton around 225 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bradshaw. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 314 and 348. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central, central and east central Nebraska.
